head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Terrorism Suspects Held In Italy And Britain

identified-content.org: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Terrorism Suspects Held In Italy And Britain

abstract.p: Milan issues arrest warrants for nine men suspected of providing logistical and financial support to Al Qaeda in Islamic Maghreb, North Africa's most active terrorist group; two arrests are made in Italy and British authorities make separate arrest in North London (S)

block.p: The authorities in Milan issued arrest warrants for nine men suspected of providing logistical and financial support to Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb, North Africa's most active terrorist group. By evening, at least two of the suspects were in Italian custody. British authorities made a separate arrest in North London as part of the sweep. The North African group, formerly the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat, claimed responsibility for the suicide bombings in Algiers in April that killed 33 people.

The authorities in Milan issued arrest warrants for nine men suspected of providing logistical and financial support to Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb, North Africa's most active terrorist group. By evening, at least two of the suspects were in Italian custody. British authorities made a separate arrest in North London as part of the sweep. The North African group, formerly the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat, claimed responsibility for the suicide bombings in Algiers in April that killed 33 people.
